channel.title: Custom Font Usage in Applications
channel.description: Hello, so say I downloaded a font off of the internet (which is obviously not a standard font) and I install it to my computer. If I use this font in my program and I distribute said program, will others have access to the font? I have a feeling that they won't. If they can't how can I make this work?

item.title: Custom Font Usage in Applications
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:4, topic:543116”]This is the scenario. I downloaded a font off of www.cooltext.com and I installed it to my Mac (which means that it is a .ttf file in the Library/Fonts/ folder on my mac). I told my Java program to set it’s font to that font. If I make this program a .jar file once I complete the game and distribute it to my friends and others (this is an offline single player game) for them to run and enjoy, can they access the font that was on my computer?[/quote]No, as you said in your original post - you need to distribute the font with/inside the jar.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Font Usage in Applications
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

You can include the font file in the program you distribute. You should be able to put it in a jar, though I’m not sure how the paths work when you do that. Anyway, you can create the font programmatically and use it that way, as long as the font file is available for use.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Font Usage in Applications
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

This is the scenario. I downloaded a font off of www.cooltext.com and I installed it to my Mac (which means that it is a .ttf file in the Library/Fonts/ folder on my mac). I told my Java program to set it’s font to that font. If I make this program a .jar file once I complete the game and distribute it to my friends and others (this is an offline single player game) for them to run and enjoy, can they access the font that was on my computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Font Usage in Applications
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Of course it can be done. Which language?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Font Usage in Applications
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

What kind of program?

It’s probably not a web application, but even so, if I’m using a custom font on a web site it’ll usually be from Google web fonts, when a user visits the site the browser will automatically download the font for them and use it on the site, so it will be available regardless of whether they have it installed on their system.

Read full topic
